website_summaries.verdict: A high-definition, lower-cost monitor with High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection (HDCP) to allow viewing of digital movies and other protected media.
pros: Includes both VGA and DVI cables
Has a bright, no-glare screen and vivid colors at all angles with no visible light bleed
Can change the settings to "Quick Startup" if slow to turn on
Gamers find it a superb high-resolution monitor for the price
cons: Does not have an HDMI port and VESA mounts are sold separately

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for the $$
customer_reviews.text: HOLY COW This monitor is GREAT for the price. Having upgraded from a 60hz monitor to this one, the difference is NIGHT AND DAY! If you're having problems getting your OS to display it in 144Hz with this monitor, DO NOT USE THE HDMI, as it can only refresh at 60hz. to get the full 144 must use the DVI cable.
customer_reviews.author: Billinn

customer_reviews.title: READ IF YOU ARE HESITANT ABOUT BUYING
customer_reviews.text: Awesome display, and the colors are very vibrant. 1080p is brilliant on this display, so good in-fact I purchased a second one! Pros: -awesome display -true 1080p -DVI cable(yesss) -adjustable tilt -HDMI compatible -true 144hz Cons: -Not really a complaint, but the display is set to SUPER BRIGHT right out of the box! To conclude: get it. I know that you have been thinking about getting one of these for a long time like I did. I too wondered if it changed my skill or anything like that and let me tell you, it did. Once you play 144hz you will never want to go back.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible display quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had this monitor for over a year and the picture was so bad I returned it. The colors are washed out and the viewing angle is plain terrible. The second monitor had the exact same problems. I spent hours on the phone with customer support and they could do nothing. They said it may be my motherboard. So I took the monitor to my job and it was terrible there too. Overall it is the worst monitor I have ever seen. I have a free throwaway from my friend which is much better and that monitor is 8 years old. Go with a different brand or at least a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Experimentb12

customer_reviews.title: Use it with Lightboost at 120 HZ for gaming
customer_reviews.text: It's best to use this monitor with lightboost at 120 hz for gaming because it has a horrible motion blur issue at 144 hz. Everything looks so much clearer on 120 hz, and it just took some color adjustment in the nvidia control panel. Before I did so, the motion blur was so bad it made me sick while gaming. Looks great on 144 hz outside of gaming though. Nice, bright display.
customer_reviews.author: Randall John

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor, but your room will glow
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor compared to my old one! Everything was great out of the box and it came with a dvi-d cable, the only problems i have with this monitor are the brightness is way to bright and the settings menu is very hard to navigate and control.
customer_reviews.author: gdsgrl

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Be wary of this monitor, right out of the box I had issues with the power supply, having to twist the input this way and that to get it to turn on. Eventually you can get it, but moving the monitor at all means another round of getting the cable just right. Finally the monitor just died on me and never came back on, was charged about 40$ to ship it out to Acer to have them repair it, but the issue with the power supply has persisted. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jullian Cockerell

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I can have extra monitor space for my business so that's why I'm not returning it. It has very poor color saturation, you can tell the difference when opening a web page and on my laptop the color is brilliant but move it over to the monitor and it gets 3 shades paler. I have messed with every setting to make it better and haven't succeeded. Also I didn't see that it didn't have HDMI connections so be aware you will have to buy a converter. Finally description states tilt-able...this monitor doesn't tilt for shyte. Other than that the size is great and it works for my spreadsheets.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C.

customer_reviews.title: Decent Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Decent monitor, blacks are a bit washed out. I have this paired with 2 same size LCD displays and you can see a big difference in brightness and contrast. Viewing angle is not great on the vertical, as it wants to be tilted back a bit, in my setup anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K.

customer_reviews.title: A great budget monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is great for the price. The monitor can get insanely bright and looks much better after manual tweaking in the settings. The only major downside in my opinion is the lack of a vesa mount makes bulky adaptors the only option to get one of these on an arm mount. Great as a first monitor or as a secondary monitor. If you have a larger budget and want something more tuned for gaming or creative workloads then id recommend pixio’s lineup of monitors as they focus on high spec monitors on the cheap.
customer_reviews.author: King of Reviews

customer_reviews.title: BAD BACKLIGHT
customer_reviews.text: This boasts as an LED Backlit monitor which SHOULD LAST 15 years or 50k hours of use. I got less than 4 years, and not even close to that many hours when you account for the amount of time I had it off (all night/most of the day). For reference I have two other monitors in my house with the same specs but from a different brand bought in 2010/2011 and they are still working perfectly. Either bad luck, or poorly designed, either way I am not pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This does just what I needed - using it as a second screen for both my work (PC) laptop and personal (Mac) laptop. - I can alternate between computers using an input selection button on the monitor, and if one computer is not running, the monitor will auto select over to the running machine. The picture is clear and colorful, and it's a good size for both writing documents and doing Photoshop work. The only negatives I can think of would be the lack of HDMI connection and the inability to adjust the height. It is possible to tilt the monitor, though, which is helpful. All in all, for the price, this works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: SteveG

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, yes you can get 144hz.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why everyone is complaining about not being able to get 144hz on 1920x1080. Have it right here and tested it online to confirm. Great monitor for the price if you're just a casual gamer and don't need insane specs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these!!!!! They are NOT what is shown in the photos!!! I am setting up a remote office and needed 2 monitors with HDMI ports in the back. The photos here show these monitors with HDMI ports but THEY DO NOT HAVE THEM. They only have a VGA and DVI ports in the back! UTTER GARBAGE. I know have to buy, and wait for, adapters. This really throws me off schedule as I needed these to work TODAY. ZERO STARS.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: Check Your Ports
customer_reviews.text: With DVI and VGA leaving the scene and being replaced with DP and HDMI 2, always check your ports. The only way you can access 144hz with this monitor is through a DVI-Dual Link cable. If your GPU doesn't have a DVI port, you're kinda screwed. However, this is a great monitor for it's price if you DO have a DVI port in your GPU. This monitor lasted me a solid 2 years and has since been passed on to a friend. Still kicking strong.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Quality monitor for low cost.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: *Excellent Monitor for the price. *No Input Lag / No noticeable Input lag.. *Great monitor for gaming. *Not harsh for the eyes (after you dim it down a bit). Cons: *Very bright out of the box - you'll need to adjust the brightness *Menu is a little difficult to navigate - it took me some time to get to where I wanted to turn down the brightness. *Can't adjust height for the monitor / monitor stand * Noticed some very slight flickering in the monitor, however I generally haven't had any issues with flickering or image
customer_reviews.author: Glory

customer_reviews.title: Excellent clarity
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for an Acer 24" screen which was excellent for 15 years but has finally died. The new screen is a perfect replacement. Due to the potential for using this screen with shutter style 3D glasses, It was initially set too bright for comfortable viewing but the brightness is adjustable through a menu (buttons on the bottom edge) and is now set for my preference. It took a little effort to set up since the menu was somewhat impatient and disappears rather quickly if you take too long. Picture quality is superb. I play games, watch movies, and surf the web. Text on websites can sometimes be quite small but still be perfectly readable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: It's quality matches its price – abhorrent.
customer_reviews.text: First off, the stand is the cheapest possible material and bends and distorts to the SMALLEST of touches. I could buy a slab of plastic and mold a greater, sturdier stand. The worst part about this monitor however, is the color production. The blacks are gray, the whites are overbearing, and the options on monitor are absolutely HORRENDOUS. This monitor is worth no more than $50. If I had paid $50 for this monitor, I'm not even sure if I'd be pleased. If returning wasn't such a hassle, I wouldn't be writing this review from this monitor's screen.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great if you like washed out colors
customer_reviews.text: Tried adjusting brightness and contrast, was unable to change enough for my liking, so I assumed it was bad. Exchanged monitor for another, and this one has the same problem, very washed out. Hands down the worst monitor I've ever purchased, could have bought a paper white CRT VGA monitor and had better color. No clue how this has almost 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. Hague

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy - Would definitely by another one.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with a home-built computer. I cannot attest for its ability to use as a gaming monitor although I do play the MYST games and Train SImulator 2019 and with an nVidia 1060 the images look perfect. I appreciate the feature that enables the monitor to be hooked up to two computers and select the active input without having to use monitor's the push buttons to select the input (unless of course both computers are powered up at the same time)
customer_reviews.author: WHASHBURN

customer_reviews.title: Best cheapest 144hertz basic monitor for every gaming needs
customer_reviews.text: RECENT BUY: Best cheapest 144hertz basic monitor for every gaming needs! No more tearing and no longer need V-sync on games! I don't care about any other feature other than the hertz. I am satisfied! Killing Floor 2, Overwatch, and Team Fortress 2 are very much on point! My specs are very bottleneck-inducing but it is worth it on 1080p! GPU: GTX 1070 CPU: FX-6300 6-Core 3-Physical cores RAM: 8GB (4x4) DDR3 Kingston RAM 1866 Clock Speed One con about monitor: Minor problem is that the stand isn't too good. It is holding well but not too much tilting or up/down stand is not available on this one. Buy a new stand for height preference!
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: No VESA holes and poor viewing angles
customer_reviews.text: No VESA mounting holes? Seriously? Yes, I know it's stated in the specs, but every other monitor ever made has these mounting holes. And this wasn't an issue until the person I got them for, decided later that they wanted them raised on a monitor arm. I had to spent another $60 for adapters, and the whole thing looks like a complete kludge. (Check out Gladiator Joe for adapters.) This monitor also has a horribly narrow viewing angle. If you're not dead-on eye level with it, it gets all washed out, or dark, depending on the viewing height. Contrast in a well lit room is also poor. It's definitely a $99 monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Kiran Otter

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck if you know how to mess with the graphics.
customer_reviews.text: Back in 2015 my father gifted me an Acer PC that came with this screen, and I always liked it because of the adjustable graphics and stand. So I got a second one, excepting it to be the same thing. It met my expectations, only issue is that it has a yellow hue; instead of white, you get this off white, and it genuinely annoys me sometimes, but I was able to describe the hue as much as possible by toying with the settings. Since I'm an artist, color really matters to me, so I just use my original screen for coloring
customer_reviews.author: Mochi

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a second monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these, using DisplayLink to connect them both to my laptop. They just work! Great resolution, good brightness and contrast, and energy saving. The perfect solution for my needs. The other one is a few years old and still has no issues with it, they're just solid little performers!
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: When it worked it was great but I was hoping to get many years out ...
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months there was a few horizontal lines appeared, luckily it was at the very top of the screen and was only noticeable when the background was black. Now, just under two years, the monitor seems not to work anymore. It repeatedly turns off and on every few seconds soon as the power is plugged in. Hooking it up to different computers didn't help. When it worked it was great but I was hoping to get many years out of this monitor, but I guess not.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S.

customer_reviews.title: OK monitor for the price. Has a very limited viewing angle.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good size for the price. Very thin and light. Stylish base. Cons: It has a VERY narrow field of focus. You have to be looking at it straight-on horizontally, and vertically, you can't drop your eye angle below the top of the screen. This is a bit disappointing as my son likes to watch movies on this while curled up in a big chair that puts his head below the top of the screen making it look less than ideal. It also has a power brick. It's a very small brick. So small, that I can't figure out why it wasn't built into the monitor. Not a huge deal, but the last thing we need is another power brick.
customer_reviews.author: D. Austin

customer_reviews.title: Your eyes will be immensely strained.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a developer and a digital artist, so I look at screens all day. Since purchasing and using this screen, I've had incredibly intense headaches and eyestrain like I've never before experienced. I've been using it since around February 2019 and am only now just realizing it's time for a change. Tried Flux (color adjusting software), decreasing the brightness and back light, everything you could imagine. Even for the cheap buy, it's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sanity

customer_reviews.title: Approved by Sasquatch Junior
customer_reviews.text: This was the last component for my 14-year-old's gaming system that he completed piece-by-piece. When it arrived I even saw the rare glimpse of his smile. Only for a moment, but it was there. And that's the last I've seen of it or him, as he's barricaded himself in his room. We have had sightings though as a smaller Sasquatch-like creature emerges to scavenge for food. Needless to say, this is an awesome monitor, great gaming HD quality, and my son appreciates me more than ever. The reminder of "Hey, who gave birth to you" has been replaced with "Hey, who bought you the HD monitor!"
customer_reviews.author: Clover  Autrey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor, great price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome monitor for less than $200. 144hz refresh is a game changer. Ordered this one for my son's PC. Comes with the dual DVI-D cableso youcan enjoy 144hz from day one. As long as your PC has a DVI-D out you should be able get 144hz to work. On a second semi-unrelated note, I wish someone would make DisplayPort 1.4 cables. Thats the only reason I have purchased a couple of these for my gaming Rig. I only have 1 Video card and hence only one DVI-D port. I have 3 DisplayPorts but only 1.4 supports 144hz.
customer_reviews.author: Nectros

customer_reviews.title: It Is Too Bright
customer_reviews.text: I rate this a 2/5 after using it a long time. The picture quality itself is fine, but the backlight is awful. no amount of settings tweaking could fix it, so it has a very bright, blue tint to the picture. i'd rather have the option to completely turn off the backlight. hurts my eyes. the only reason i kept this was 'cause i didn't wanna deal with refunds or shipping back n' forth. would not recommend. if you're fine with staring at a fluorescent bulb for hours, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: The price is cheap because the product is.
customer_reviews.text: If it's worth it to you to pay the $90 to have a working monitor for six months, then by all means get this. After I had it six months, a line developed across the screen. Customer support (uncaring and unhelpful) could only offer that I could send it in - at my expense - where they would keep it at least 14 days to maybe fix it. Then ship it back to me. This is what the warranty gets you: three weeks, at least, without a monitor. I'm chucking the thing and bought a new one, NOT an Acer, at a local store. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: J Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Clear picture. Going from 60 to 144hz is big difference. Improved my gaming fps and overall viewing experience. Great price during Black Friday sales. Con: Cant adjust monitor stand forwards/backwards. Not too big of a problem for me though. Been using close to two months now. Have had no problems, no dead pixels or anything like that. Hope it stays that way. Edit: Minus a star. Cannot adjust audio from the monitor shortcut menu.
customer_reviews.author: Mystery Man

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good if you want 60hz for a week or so,
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review as I have JUST hooked up this screen, you'll have your 144hz as soon as you can get a good DL cord, mine came faulty with pushed in pins. I don't want to contact Acer for a free cord, I just really wanted my cord to work in the first place. Within a week or so I should get my new cord, I may update my review when I do.
customer_reviews.author: Boo Boo the Fool

customer_reviews.title: Have had the monitor GN246HL for about a week now and love playing my steam games
customer_reviews.text: Read the one star reviews and concluded they were spam. Have had the monitor GN246HL for about a week now and love playing my steam games, World of Warcraft, and Star Wars, the old republic at 144 hz. Was easy enough to set up. Have new system, Intel I7-7700 with Nvidia 1060. If you don't have a GPU that will support 144hz then you will be at 60 hz only. One other note, just because you have it setup to run at 144 hz, doesn't mean that everything will run at that speed. Most things will run faster than 60hz though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is OK. Maybe it's cause I go from my Macbook and iMac to this, but the picture quality is pretty meh. The screen is too bright. And the contrast is way too high. I don't like that I can't edit photos on it without them looking terrible. Gaming-wise, there's not much to complain about. It's a good monitor for gaming! I just wish it was good for more.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: 144 Hz only works on DVI-DL
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these monitors because they had a high refresh rate and low response time for the cost. But after I went to set up the monitors, I found out after some research that you can only run anything over 60 Hz with DVI, which my graphics card doesn't support (NVidia 1080), so my options were to spend money on a converter from DisplayPort to DVI-DL, buy different monitors, or deal with 60 FPS on all my games. It's not the worst thing in the world to have happen but it is disappointing especially because I bought these monitors specifically to run 144 FPS.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Turmel

customer_reviews.title: Cheap no HDMI...
customer_reviews.text: cheap. Not good for gaming at all. Who doesn't install an HDMI connector on modern monitors? Had to purchase an AVI to HDMI connector as no newer laptops come with AVI connections any more. Too slow for modern graphics. Monitor lags, have to turn down video settings in game. And have top of line Nvidea graphics card. Monitor has no support for AMD or Nvidia.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Washed out colors, black is more gray, hurts my 👀
customer_reviews.text: (Far right screen) Terrible washed out color. The black isn’t even black. Compared to my other 2 monitors this one has terrible color quality. Went thru every brightness & contrast option but nothing makes it look better. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Still holds up for 1080pi 144hz with DVI
customer_reviews.text: 144hz IS ONLY FOR DVI OUTPUT. MAKE SURE YOU HAVE A DVI CABLE AND YOUR GPU SUPPORTS DVI BEFORE BUYING. Bought this in 2017 and still using it with no real complaints. Monitor is very bright even at minimum settings on both monitor and pc display settings. I have to use external apps like Rainmeter to lower my brightness even further. Still satisfied with 1080p 144fps, but at this pricepoint and time I would consider a higher resolution monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Dies rather quickly
customer_reviews.text: Just don't buy it, it'll die while other monitors last for over a decade. I purchased it maybe 2 years ago. Light use, treated carefully, died over night while sleeping for no reason. I'm not the only person suffering this issue, there are tons of people suffering the same hardware failure indicated by the power led. Just buy something less cheap, you'll be thankful.
customer_reviews.author: JustSam

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy For The Price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty large and works some great and clear. Took a little time to figure it out when don't have an HDMI connection but has the monitor to PC connection as well so works with no difficulity. Had an older Acer and lasted for years and saved my wife's monitor it was small and this one takes up the space in my computer desk unit with 3 inches left on each side for my external speakers recessed slightly behind it. Great buy and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Morgan Sr.

customer_reviews.title: VGA port failed after 2 days, no good mounting solutions.
customer_reviews.text: VGA port failed after 2 days. Box arrived in fine condition but the styrofoam was punctured in some places. Not sure if it fell out of the box during shipping or if a manufacturing flaw. Mounting brackets can be purchased separately but they do not reach the middle of the monitor. Causing the monitor to be pretty offset if mounting on a monitor stand.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: My eyeballs love this monitor!
customer_reviews.text: ok so a little bit of background on me...i am a dry eye sufferer. so with that said, i went through several different monitors and each one made my eyes so freakin dry. I finally got my hands on this acer g226hql and finally my eyes are not bothered. it also has an option in the settings to toggle bluelight on/off. so if you also suffer from dry eyes i would highly highly recommend this monitor to you.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: This monitor was not my first choice for a 144Hz gamimg monitor, but I am floored by how good it is for the price. I've had it for about a month now and have not run into any issues at all. I have it set at 120Hz mode. I would buy another of these to replace my second monitor! Things to note though: - Monitor stand doesn't move up or down - Colors are washed out right out of the box (I just used the NVIDIA control panel to adjust vividness and saturation) - Takes like 3 seconds to boot up (saw some people complaining about that?)
customer_reviews.author: Banhi Banhi

customer_reviews.title: Day and Night. Entered 144hz
customer_reviews.text: Ok. Where to begin. I have always gamed on 60hz monitors and I always felt like I was lagging because I have a powerful PC but to many frames. So I invested in a 144hz monitor. I am SO GLAD I DID! Smooth it’s all I can say, looks very crisp, no dead pixels and it’s everything that I need to have in a monitor. Kinda wish it had a display port but it has DVI-D. YOU NEED A DVI-D to run at 144hz. Other than that the colors are bright, the monitors actually pretty bright but I like how it looks.
customer_reviews.author: DAFatbOy101

customer_reviews.title: Me and my brother both love it!
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is that the stand is a little loose, but honestly most monitor stands are not perfect. This monitor is the best 144hz monitor for it's price, I bought one for me and my brother and we love it. NOTE: Please make sure you're video card can handle it before you buy this monitor and look up how to change "REFRESH RATE" to 144hz
customer_reviews.author: Kwang

customer_reviews.title: Coming from 60Hz on a budget? BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.text: After a budget build and being stuck with a low end non gaming 60Hz monitor for 6 months I decided to make the switch to 144Hz. It is INSANE the amount of difference a switch to 144Hz can make. I highly recommend you consider this monitor as an upgrade. It’s very easily vesa mountable, the colors are sharp in my opinion (coming from a lower end IPS panel) and this monitor is excellent. Once you see 144Hz you will never switch back to 60Hz I promise you. I could immediately tell the difference in my mouse cursor moving. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: I had issues
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, this thing is BRIGHT, I recommend turning it down. Color looks better than I expected. Update: so apparently I didn't realize that I wasn't getting 144hz for like a year, one I started checking frame rates I found out that I needed to change the setting in windows. Once I finally figured that out it was well past the return window and if I push the monitor to 144hz I get a noticeable horizontal white line across the screen, about a pixel thick. If I take it down to 120hz it's much harder to see and at 90hz it's gone completely. Still very disappointed because it should run flawlessly at 144hz
customer_reviews.author: C Fox

customer_reviews.title: Overall good monitor for $89. If you are at all into photography, etc then consider upgrading to an Acer with better specs.
customer_reviews.text: Lets face it. I paid $89 for this monitor so I could impress the ladies. And by ladies I mean my wife. And she's not impressed. But she is happy so I've got that going for me. That said....the negatives are the colors aren't very vibrant and it doesn't have an HDMI input. I didn't notice that last part before buying it. I ended up having to buy a DVI-D to mini display cable. Keep in mind it has two inputs (DVI-D & VGA). Overall good monitor for $89. If you are at all into photography, etc then consider upgrading to an Acer with better specs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff N

customer_reviews.text: I didn't read the description close enough; I didn't realize this monitor doesn't have an HDMI port, nor does it have built-in speakers. I had to buy a DVI-to-HDMI cable. Not a big deal, but slightly inconvenient. Other than that, it's a perfectly suitable monitor. I really like that it's adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: David Abbott

customer_reviews.title: It's Good for Budgets. (NO DISPLAYPORT)
customer_reviews.text: (bought back in dec. 2018); • no dead pixels (oct. 2019) Gaming: Enables decent 144hz gaming (provided your rig can achieve it.) NO DISPLAY PORT CONNECTIONS DVI/ HDMI Picture quality: A little blurry, Blacks aren't as black as one might like. There are definitely better options on the market for a little more money. Overall: if you just want a 144hz monitor for a few games you can run 144hz; go for it if you're cheap like me.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: An Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: I was really really happy with this monitor. It comes with EVERYTHING you need, including cables. The best part about it, besides its great resolution is the buttons used to configure the contrast, brightness, etc. are all labeled on the screen once you activate them. So there's no frustration about figuring out the right button to press. Its factory settings are a little bright, but, with the help of your computer, you can adjust it. This is a great buy, I would highly recommend this monitor to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Randall C Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Note this monitor hs no HDMI port
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a budget build I was doing and it is a ok monitor. When I purchased it I didn't notice it did not have HDMI, which today is standard on everything. Unfortunately the PC I built didn't have a DVI or VGA so I had to get a adapter. This of course was my fault so I didn't remove a star for it, but I thought it should be mentioned. The only other complaint is the viewing angle isn't the best. If I lean back and to the side in my chair its pretty noticeable. Other than that its not bad in anyway. No dead pixels, and the color is good.
customer_reviews.author: Divus

customer_reviews.title: Overly saturated screen
customer_reviews.text: I hate how overly saturated this monitor is - I've tried adjusting the settings so many times and it's always either too bright or the colors are overly saturated. It honestly gives me a headache to look at this screen. You can't see any detailing in pictures with this awful image.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: To all the complainers..BUY A STAND...
customer_reviews.text: You can’t beat the price. $180 for a monitor that gives you everything you need for gaming. It’s true you can’t tilt or raise the monitor however all you need to do is buy a cheap $20 stand on amazon and you’re set .. it’s not that hard. It raises the total price to $200. That’s still cheaper then most monitors on amazon that have the ability to tilt the monitor. The was a good purchase, screen looks good while gaming. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Good for its price.
customer_reviews.text: Very affordable monitor that looks pretty good overall. But the low price comes with some baggage. The screen is washed out at any viewing angle that is just a few degrees out of ideal dead-on. I had to set the monitor up higher than I had intended to because I couldn't always make out things like dialogue boxes on websites. Plus, my computer puts out the same resolution as this monitor displays native, and yet some text takes on a slightly blocky texture that normally only happens when you haven't matched output to native resolution. It is minor but it you are a perfectionist than you have no business looking at this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: bugmanpat

customer_reviews.title: STUCK PIXEL
customer_reviews.text: I have a stuck pixel on the bottom right of the screen and only had this for 6 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely good for the price
customer_reviews.text: While I only gave this monitor four stars, I wholeheartedly recommend it, as it's a very good monitor. When I got it, it turned out to have a "hot" pixel (a pixel that glowed a particular colour). For various reasons, I failed to contact the seller, and I'm not even sure if that would be sufficient for a replacement (doubtful). The pixel ended up fixing itself. Aside from the one issue, the colours are fantastic for the price, the contrast is well done, the dark colours are displayed well, and it's a very nice size. Due to my failure to contact the seller, and my overall appreciation of this monitor, it gets a solid five stars... a very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Acer 21.5 Inch Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Good monitor for the price. The tilt feature for me is not an issue as some users have mentioned, it adjusts just fine for me. It comes with a VGA and DVI cables, many monitors come with only a VGA. My only issue is the buttons to adjust contrast, color etc. They are on the bottom edge it the monitor. There are no indications on the face on the unit to indicate what each of the four buttons control, which makes it a bit inconvenient to make adjustments, but once the initial adjustments are made you're done. Quick and easy set up, good color and a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Carla & John

customer_reviews.title: Acer 21.5 inch Screen LED Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the negative reviews, but my use of the monitor is strictly for personal use at home. I really like it, it is an upgrade from my 17" monitor which went south on a couple of days ago. It was a good monitor, I had it for a little over 7 years, guess it was just tired. Anyway, the colors on this monitor are great, seem to be vivid and good quality. I know it's a great purchase for me and was delivered before the estimated date of delivery. If it last as long as the last one, I'll be really satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Robertson

customer_reviews.title: 60hz to 144hz this is EPIC!!!
customer_reviews.text: People say the color profile is crappy, but it was a HUGE upgrade from my previous Samsung monitor. I've been looking into the Lightboost hack, but it is almost not necessary because the improvement from 60hz to 144hz is so great, I don't want to exert the extra effort. For those who play CSGO... I s*** you not, I ranked up after playing my first game with this.... some say it was luck... some say it was the blindingly fast refresh rate that helped me. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: W1R3S

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done for a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Viewing angles are terrible, and color reproduction is mediocre at best. I wanted to love this monitor, but I've just had to sell it to upgrade to the, and couldn't be happier with the decision. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money on something better. If you don't know about IPS (like I didn't), do yourself a favor and read about it BEFORE assuming you're getting an awesome deal. You'll be disappointed if you try to look at this monitor at any angle other than a dead-on shot (or close to it).
customer_reviews.author: Rasgur Singh

customer_reviews.title: Great budget 144hz monitor
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have as many features as other monitors, or a truly adjustable stand, but for a budget it works fine. Had this weird issue though where I couldn't get it to 144hz for some reason, but then I used some strobelight utility that is supposed to enable the strobelight abilities of the monitor while outside of 3d mode and that had options to enable 144hz. I did contact support about the missing 144hz but support didn't help at all, it was weird though, the support guy quoted directly one of the solutions I already found from Google but couldn't find this utility that has the exact feature I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Solid low-end monitor, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: These monitors are great value for the price. The image is clear, bright, of good resolution for the size, and it functions perfectly out of the box. Be forewarned: no HDMI input. One caveat: the description says VESA mounts are sold separately, and some reviews state they have VESA mounts. The model I received did NOT have VESA mount holes, which meant I had to get creative. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Best Budget 144hz monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Very good monitor for the Price, dont listen to the last comment saying that it doesn't work on Windows 10 because well, its a monitor, there aren't drivers for monitors lol. To be able to use 144hz you have to have DVI not HDMI, other than addressing that the monitor is great! Good quality although a little bright (nothing f.lux cant fix!) and the stand is very good, very little wobble! Arrived with no dead pixels and overall very pleased with this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Drennan

customer_reviews.title: Uneven brightness & contrast from top to bottom
customer_reviews.text: Uneven brightness & contrast from top to bottom. Got it today and tinkered with adjustments, I'm very familiar with monitors and I have an Acer I like, but THIS one's going back on day 1. The top third of the monitor is great. It has the right amount of contrast and rich colors. The middle is a little flat and the bottom third of the monitor is unacceptably flat and "blown out" bright. This has nothing to do with viewing angle or monitor adjustments. This monitor is simply uneven in brightness and contrast from top to bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B

customer_reviews.title: Defective product, inadequately supported.
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is defective - blinks out at random. The manufacturer will only service and not replace the product. Since the defect occurred after a month had passed, we have no option to have a reliable monitor except to buy a new one. We will not buy Acer and recommended that you do not do so either.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Haracz

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, High Quality Picture
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our home camera security system, we get HD pics that are truly great!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bob Traveller

customer_reviews.title: 144hz, but for a limited period of time
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my GPU and suddenly the DVI connection no longer works as it should. DVI defaults now to a low resolution and will not support any custom changes. NVIDIA control panel reads it as a "Digital Display" and Windows Display Settings do not even show a name. Works fine with HDMI, but not the reason why i bought a 144hz monitor. After hours of searching for a fix, the culprit seems to be an EDID issue, that is fairly complicated to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is as good as 144hz, your eyes will thank you for it. Worth every penny - This thing has lasted me for almost a year and its going strong. - True 144hz, Ahh i don't know how to describe it. Having that many hz will make anyone in awe. - Competitive edge, you will be able to aim better and track easier. Cons: - Color accuracy is non existent with this monitor. Some colors are washed out, (Not for designers.) - The huge power brick. (Not a deal breaker, but it takes desk space)
customer_reviews.author: MX2142

customer_reviews.title: Does not support 144hz through hdmi
customer_reviews.text: This product is useless for 144hz if you plan on using it with a newer graphics card. It only supports 144hz through the dvi and vga ports. It only has 3 video ports dvi vga and hdmi ports which would be fine if they had a better hdmi port. Through the hdmi port you can only get up to 60hz... so DO NOT buy this if you have a newer graphics card.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Ricky Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but super narrow viewing angle
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap. It works. But, with the default settings, the color looks pretty washed out. Make sure to go to your operating system settings and drop the gamma to make things look better. The vertical viewing angle seems super narrow. If your head is just a bit about the display, the screen is unreadable. But if you position the monitor at just the right height, and adjust your OS gamma, the display works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle Guillotine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing display and graphics
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great monitor. I had an older monitor, but I was upgrading my computer to run faster and better handle all the gaming that I do. One of my last upgrades was the monitor, and I'm so glad I did. The display is amazing, the graphics are incredible, and it keeps up with the speeds that my computer is running at. I basically use my computer solely for gaming now, and there is no comparison between this monitor and my old one. Definitely a worth-while purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BRoti

customer_reviews.title: Easy Recommendation
customer_reviews.text: Quick review: I'm thoroughly impressed so far with my purchase. I mostly use this for gaming and YouTube. The quality is much above my previous "traditional" monitors in both picture quality and buttery smoothness. There's a great little trick you can apply to the monitor that utilizes the light boost tech for a smoothness that's similar to a CRT monitor which is REALLY cool. All you need to do is lookup the model number and lightboost on YouTube. I haven't tried the 3D itself yet, still need to get those $100 nvidia glasses... I'm very tempted though. Otherwise I'm extremely happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ScotDam

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor for the price once you get it calibrated
customer_reviews.text: Good monitor for the price once you get it calibrated, which is the tricky part. Out of the box the color is very washed out, and adjusting the picture isn't the easiest thing in the world with the settings on the monitor. Auto-adjust is nearly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Schroen

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is not bad. It’s not awesome either. The colors need a little tuning out of the box. Also when you first turn it on, colors are kind of lite and then it improves as it warms up. Could just be me. For the price I would probably recommend it again, especially if you are coming from an old crappy monitor.
customer_reviews.author: JDP

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: These monitors are just fine for the price. They are crisp and responsive. My only complaint would be that black colors are not near as black as my more expensive LG monitor. Also, There are no holes for mounting on a stand or wall. No HDMI either. DVI and VGA only. I bought 2 of these for a triple screen setup for sim games and I am happy with the performance for the price. They are fairly lightweight but not very cheap or flimsy feeling. I got pretty much what I expected and am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: 02stampede

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitor, the colors are really nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor, the colors are really nice. There's no HDMI hookup which is disappointing, since I can only use it for my computers. The screen doesn't adjust/tilt, it's fixed to the stand. It's very leightweight and it doesn't use a lot of power. I've never had connection issues or graphics issues because of it. No dead spots after three years of continuous use and moving it around.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Crain

customer_reviews.title: 2 1/2 years in
customer_reviews.text: so I have this for two and a half years now first of all if you get ghosting or you burn your screen which is what I ended up doing just pull up a black picture for about a day and it should fix it but this also is only 144 Hertz through DVI dual everything else will not work and will be cap at 60fps
customer_reviews.author: TiedStatistic

customer_reviews.title: then these screens are great for non-gaming applications
customer_reviews.text: if you plan to mount this to a VESA mount (buy an adapter kid.. about 30 bucks) then i would suggest you go with a diff. monitor that is already built to be mounted/ accommodate a VESA mount. the support screw in the base looks very very cheap.. i am concerned that the screens will eventually fall forward b/c the plastic around the support screw in the base will snap/ break from wear. if using on a desk without a VESA mount, then these screens are great for non-gaming applications.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: This is a good monitor for entry-level 1080p viewing
customer_reviews.text: This is a good monitor for entry-level 1080p viewing. The monitor have a very narrow viewing angle. You have to look at it dead center, or the colors will be washed out a bit. My eyes are looking directly straight at the monitor so I do not notice it at all. The contrast is not that good. Changing contrast on the screen is pretty much like changing the brightness while not having the colors to be differentiated. It is better to change the display settings using your GPU software. I use Nvidia and increase digital vibrancy and contrast for better picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: John Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: This monitor only lasted for about 2 months without breaking.
customer_reviews.text: I got this monitor as a gift for my son who is into gaming. He said that while the monitor worked the 144hz refresh rate and 1080p resolution were great. Once my son left this monitor on all night and the next morning the monitor had a black light on the LED and would not turn on. Another problem we had with the monitor was that the screen was not very sturdy. It would wobble and did not appear to be very well glued to the frame. I would recomend buying a more expensive 144hz monitor if you really want the fast refresh rate because this one is not very sturdy or durable.
customer_reviews.author: fita

customer_reviews.title: Not same as the pictures
customer_reviews.text: My fault for not reading the fine print, but just looking at the pictures. This monitor does not have HDMI ports as the images show. It is only DVI and VGA. Oh well, it will have to do for what i'm using it for. Works fine, just really wanted an HDMI port.
customer_reviews.author: ok11f150

customer_reviews.title: 144hz with a DVI connection only.
customer_reviews.text: Luckily this wasn't a problem for me as my PC is compatible, but it is something to note. Besides that, this is a fantastic, quality monitor and I'm extremely satisfied with it. I have not had any issues and the picture is flawless.
customer_reviews.author: lone gunman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor! One tiny problem...
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is killer! I chose the right gaming monitor for me although I have to use hdmi because the dual link cable isn’t long enough, overall this monitor is really good! But people say that only dual link supports 144hz I have to use HDMI which only does 60 hz it doesn’t really bother me that much but I just wish that the dual like cable was a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: magdaleno campos

customer_reviews.title: Bad design and instruction
customer_reviews.text: The display quality is average 3 star and price is 5 star. The worst is design and instruction, 1 star. Not easy to figure out how to assemble and disassemble. Quick Guide has no guide and the accompany CD has nothing. Out of the box it has reddish color and the picture is horrible, and I got "No Signal" while connecting to a laptop. I tried it on several computers. It is also difficult to adjust, but eventually it displays satisfactorily. Nowadays I expect LCD monitor to work out of box in 30 minutes. It wasted me several hours. It has been working fine for a month. Increase to 3 star.
customer_reviews.author: Enzhong A. Fu

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while ago as a budget 144hz option and it is still chugging along. Some of the colors and viewing angles are not stellar, and there MIGHT be some slight ghosting, but as long as you know what you are getting it should not be too bad. Do your research!
customer_reviews.author: Joricky

customer_reviews.title: and this monitor is really good for the priced I paid on Black Friday
customer_reviews.text: This review is from my husband which I purchased the monitor for. I moved from an Alienware AW2310 which failed on me after 6 years of service, and this monitor is really good for the priced I paid on Black Friday. ($149). No dead pixels and the 3D games and movies look amazing in this monitor. THE OSD menu can be a little more user friendly but is something that does affects the performance of the monitor. I can live with that!! Even at the regular price it is still a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Agripina Galarza

customer_reviews.title: Xbox 120 hz? You need dvi to HDMI cable!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok. Read the title! I bought this thinking it will give my Xbox up to 120 hz (Xbox does support this). But here is the catch! This monitor only support 120 hz if you use a dvi to HDMI cable. Otherwise, if you use HDMI cable only, it will only support up to 60hz. Read this before buying!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent screen;
customer_reviews.text: Excellent screen; .24 mm dot pitch I think; mine was hard to tilt so I took the part that connects to the screen apart by removing two screws and then loosened the screw that was keeping it from tilting a bit and put it back together and now it tilts easily. When I plugged it in and hit the switch and hit enter on the keyboard everything popped up perfectly. My system is windows 7. To quote another review I saw on here for 100 dollars this thing is spectacular.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: My Son is over the moon with this!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son as part of his Christmas present. I am like the "BEST" Mom ever as he can't stop telling me how happy he is with this monitor. When playing his video games, there is no lag or delay on the moves. The graphics look awesome. His is very, very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as my first 144hz monitor in preparation for my new gaming PC that I just recently built. I can immediately see the difference in fluid motion when comparing it to my other 60hz monitor. This is great as an entry level monitor for those not looking to shell out a ton of money, I think it looks crisp, has great colors, and has a sleek design. The stand is a tiny bit wobbly but not to the point that I notice any motion. Overall I am very happy I purchased it and works great for those of us not looking to break the bank on high end monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad monitor for the price, the only thing that would have made this a bit better is an hdmi por witch this doesnt have but not a problem for most if you have a dedicated graphics card as the all cinnection cords are included. For use with anything else that requieres hdmi just use an adapter.
customer_reviews.author: luis

customer_reviews.title: He seems to be satisfy with the monitor and it hasn't given him any ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor for a 15 year-old who plays game. He seems to be satisfy with the monitor and it hasn't given him any problem so far. BTW, the monitor color is nice and looks great! Very good price for 1ms response time with 144Hz refresh rate. Plenty of input options so it will work with almost any application.
customer_reviews.author: Giang VuTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for a lower price 144hz monitor
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite happy with my purchase of this 24" 144hz monitor from Acer. There's nothing to complain about from a visual perspective- the color is bright and full and the 144hz refresh rate is great for competitive fps gaming. Unfortunately this display can not be raised, lowered, or tilted so if you want to have better control over the monitor you need to purchase a mount. However, I do not mind this lack of flexibility especially for the price- the lowest I could find for a 24" 144hz monitor. Overall, if you are in need of a 144hz monitor for a budget build this is the monitor you should get.
customer_reviews.author: Jason J.

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor but no holes for VESA mounts and no HDMI
customer_reviews.text: Is a pretty good monitor. Biggest drawback is does not have holes for VESA mounts. Also the bracket with holes is about $32, meaning you can buy a better monitor with holes... for the same price or cheaper. Of course I just had the bracket made as I bought 10 of them for a CCTV security monitor display, but STILL. No HDMI means another $5 for HDMI to DVI connector. Again the monitor is fine but the ups and extras add to a better monitor for the same approx price. Also NO SPEAKER if you're considering using it for a cable tv/satellite display.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mayer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING works flawlessly! Very good bright display! Has lightboost!
customer_reviews.text: Its amazing works great just needs some colors tweaked it came excessively warm color temperature but easily adjusted via the settings. Very bright display. and pretty cool that it has light boost! Only slight issue is noticable inverse ghosting because of the strong pixel overdrive. Wish it was adjustable!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Newman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: Monitor lacks a DisplayPort port so you're stuck using Dual-Link DVI cables and it's incompatible with many dongles and cables, and the industry is moving away from DVI so you may be SOL when upgrading a video card. Picture quality and colors are bad even for a TN panel, other 144hz panels such as the BenQ and Asus competitors have better color representation. Spend a little extra on monitors with better support and better picture.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Kumiega

customer_reviews.title: "Supports 144 HZ"  Or maybe 60
customer_reviews.text: In the "comparisons with similar products" it says the refresh rate is 60...and that is what I get...not 144. I bought an Acer predator gaming laptop and hooked it with high speed HDMI to this new Monitor. All settings info says the limit is 60 HZ. The Manual says max res is 1920 x 1080 @ 120 HZ. It does not say how to get a high refresh rate. The advertising emphasizes 144, but I will never see that. I could get the same picture on any HD monitor for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: joseph peters

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Clear, smooth, easy to clean, and has lasted a year so far! Edit: 3 years in, still using the screen. Not 1 dead pixel to be found. Edit: 5 years and 1 month almost. Still using it. Not 1 dead pixel. Thinking about buying another monitor for my gaming setup and I'm highly leaning toward another Acer because of how long this one has lasted even though i wipe the screen with a damp cloth sometimes to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Honest

customer_reviews.title: VERY satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit underwhelmed at first, because I could not tell the difference in frame rate (Just upgraded from 60Hz) but you need to go into your settings and change it to 144Hz from there. After that, just moving my cursor on my desktop made me happy because of how smooth it was. Very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Shoup

product_meta.title: Acer G226HQL 21.5-Inch Screen LED Monitor
product_meta.description: Size:21.5-Inch| Style:Full HD (1920 x 1080)| Configuration:SingleAcer G-Series monitors sport a super-slim profile with an X-shaped stand that lets them fit nicely in spaces of any size. Outstanding performance, eco-friendliness and smart use of energy complement the sleek design - all while staying well within budget. The Acer G226HQL Bbd showcases a 21. 5" Widescreen LCD with impressive 1920 x 1080 resolution. Enjoy widely available 16: 9 HD digital content without image distortion on the expansive widescreen LCD. The remarkable 100 Million: 1 contrast ratio ensures a crystal-clear viewing experience while rapid 5ms response time keeps moving images sharp. It also supports both VGA and DVI inputs offering greater compatibility. The Acer G-Series LCD brings an amazing multimedia experience to your home with a widescreen cinematic view and a unique fighter pilot style. Aspect Ratio:16:9.Viewing Angles : 90° Horizontal,50° Vertical. Brightness 200 cd/m²(The candela per square metre )
feature_bullets: The G-Series 21.5" LED is designed for High-Definition with a stunning 1920 x 1080 resolution
Rapid 5ms response time reduces deviations in transition time to deliver high-quality moving images bringing immersive graphics to your movies and games
The DVI-D input with High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection (HDCP) allows for viewing of digital movies and copy-protected media
Signal Inputs: 1 x DVI w/HDCP & 1 X VGA. Dimensions(H x W x D): 12.28 x 20.08 x 1.26 inches (without stand), 14.4 x 20.1 x 6.7 inches(with stand)
No HDMI Ports. VESA mounts sold separately. Stand: Tiltable (-5° to 15°). Using OSD, adjust brightness and contrast to maximum or reset to their default settings
Signal Inputs: 1 x DVI w/HDCP & 1 X VGA. Maximum Resolution: 1920 x 1080, Standard Refresh Rate: 60 Hz. Twisted Nematic Film (TN Film) (90°x50°)
VESA mounts Holes and HDMI Ports not included. Interfaces/Ports: DVI VGA, Standby Power Consumption: 450 mW Off-Mode Power Consumption: 400 mW

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,744 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
